page.title: 07FAUNA OF THE AREA
page.content: There is a varied fauna in the area.Occasional visitors to the river are deer-these more especially in the east of the area.Foxes are very common in the area and are regularly hunted or shot. Mink do not seem to have reached this area yet. Fish found include trout (brown and rainbow) and salmon. With the water being clean there is a multitude of insect life, some of the commonest being caddis-fly larva, pond skaters and stone-fly larva. There is not much vegetation in the river for feeding. Common birds found in the area include ring-ouzels, dippers an oystercatchers. Relative newcomers to the area include the gosander which is blamed for taking large numbers of fish. Herons are also found on some of the moorland burns.
